Check and summarize multiple class memberships

Source: R/checks.R
check_multiple_class_memberships.Rd

Identifies and summarizes cases where students are assigned to multiple classes for the same subject within schools. This is commonly used to detect overlapping or duplicated class memberships (for example, students appearing in multiple mathematics classes). The function creates per-school summaries and writes them to an Excel workbook for manual review.

Usage

check_multiple_class_memberships(
  class_list_df,
  schools,
  WondeData,
  year_codes_target = c("Year 7", "7", "Y7"),
  subject_keywords = c("Maths", "Mathematics", "Ma", "Mathematic"),
  output_prefix = "Checking_subject_classes_overlap"
)

Arguments

class_list_df

A data frame containing the combined class list across all schools. Must include at least the columns `"Class Name"` and `"URN"`.

schools

A data frame containing school metadata, with at least the columns `id`, `URN`, and `name`.

WondeData

A named list of Wonde school extracts, such as those returned by `get_secondary_school_student_data()`. Each list element should include at least the components `student`, `students_classes`, and `subjects`.

year_codes_target

Character vector of year codes used to identify target students (for example, `c("Year 7", "7", "Y7")`).

subject_keywords

Character vector of subject name keywords (case-insensitive) used to select relevant subject classes, typically for a specific subject such as mathematics.

output_prefix

Character string giving the file name prefix for the generated Excel report. Default is `"Checking_subject_classes_overlap"`.

Value

A named list in which each element corresponds to a school and contains:

`class_stud`

A data frame summarizing each class's description, student count, and overlap information.

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Cleans and restructures the input `class_list_df` using helper functions: `clean_class_names()`, `reduce_to_best_teacher()`, and `produce_class_lists()`.

  2. Identifies schools with students listed in multiple classes (based on comma-separated `"Class Name"` entries).

  3. For each school, filters students to those with year codes in `year_codes_target` and subjects matching `subject_keywords`.

  4. Summarizes each class's description, size, and student overlap counts.

  5. Exports the results to an Excel workbook (`*_before_fix.xlsx`), with one sheet per school showing class size and overlap information.

Excel output structure

The exported workbook (named using `output_prefix`) contains one worksheet per school. Each worksheet includes a summary table with the following columns:

`classes.data__name`

The name of the class.

`classes_desc`

The class description field from Wonde data, if available.

`size`

The number of unique students assigned to the class.

`classes_overlap`

A newline-separated list showing which other classes share students with the given class, in the format `"OtherClassName -> N"`, where `N` is the number of overlapping students. If no overlaps are found, the value is `"No other"`.

The workbook file is saved as:


  <output_prefix>_before_fix.xlsx

and can be used to manually inspect or validate data cleaning results.

See also

[openxlsx::createWorkbook()], [openxlsx::writeDataTable()], [clean_class_names()], [reduce_to_best_teacher()], [produce_class_lists()]

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
overlaps <- check_multiple_class_memberships(
  class_list_df = class_list_df,
  schools = schools,
  WondeData = WondeData,
  year_codes_target = c("Year 7", "7", "Y7"),
  subject_keywords = c("Maths", "Mathematics"),
  output_prefix = "maths_class_overlap"
)

# View the first school's summary
overlaps[[1]]$class_stud
} # }
